title: 105_s1513
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF TAX-EXEMPT BOND FINANCING OF CERTAIN ELECTRICAL OUTPUT FACILITIES." is a summary of a specific section related to tax-exempt bond financing for certain electrical output facilities. Certain Transactions Treated as Sales to General Public for Purposes of Private Business Tests. Amendment to the definition of nonqualified amount for private business use under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The nonqualified amount for private business use under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall not include certain transactions involving output facilities furnishing electric energy to other government facilities for government use. The output exchange agreement allows facilities to meet peak load demands or handle temporary outages without being a net seller of output, involving output-type contracts, or exceeding 30 days duration. The amendment allows for the termination of tax-exempt bond financing for electrical output facilities participating in open access plans, ensuring that such bonds remain tax-exempt. The amendment allows for tax-exempt bonds to cease for electrical output facilities if an irrevocable election is made as prescribed by the Secretary. This election applies to all output facilities for electric energy, prohibits issuing tax-exempt bonds after participation in an open access plan, and requires outstanding bonds used for financing to comply. The amendment requires redemption of outstanding bonds used to finance electrical output facilities within 6 months of a specified date, depending on when the bonds were issued. The amendment requires redemption of outstanding bonds used to finance electrical output facilities within 6 months of a specified date or 10 years after the enactment of the subsection. An open access plan allows multiple electric energy providers in a competitive market, and related persons include groups of related individuals. The term 'person' includes related persons within the meaning of section 144(a)(3). The effective date for the amendments is after November 8, 1997.
